column1: fact
The Indian government has announced free electricity to all farmers starting July 2025.
India’s GDP grew by 7.2% in 2024.
The central bank raised interest rates in June 2025.
Aadhaar cards are required for all government schemes.
COVID-19 vaccinations were made free for adults in India in 2021.
Electricity subsidies in Karnataka were increased in 2025.
Solar power adoption among Indian farmers rose by 10% since 2024.
Minimum support price for wheat was raised in 2025.
GST rate changes were announced in December 2025.
Jal Jeevan Mission targets water access to all rural households by 2026.
India’s literacy rate crossed 80% in 2025.
Ayushman Bharat provides free healthcare to families below poverty line.
Jan Dhan Yojana has helped open over 450 million bank accounts.
Mobile data usage in India increased by 40% in 2025.
The government launched the Digital India initiative in 2015.
Interest rates on student loans were reduced in September 2025.
Wind energy accounted for 8% of India’s electricity generation in 2024.
Renewable energy capacity in India reached 168 GW in 2025.
The PM-KISAN scheme provides ₹6,000 annually to farmers.
Inflation in India averaged 4.3% during 2025.
The unemployment rate fell to 5.6% in March 2025.
Agricultural exports from India hit $53 billion in 2024.
Direct Benefit Transfer reduced subsidy leakages by 30%.
NITI Aayog released the latest SDG Index in August 2025.
Self-help groups increased by 18% since 2023.
Government started ration card portability in 2024.
Rainfall in Kerala was above normal in June 2025.
India produces the most pulses worldwide.
Female labor force participation rose to 24% in 2025.
Swachh Bharat Mission improved rural sanitation coverage to 98%.
The latest Census was conducted in 2021.
The number of startups in India crossed 100,000 in 2025.
ISRO launched Aditya-L1 solar mission in 2023.
PM Narendra Modi was re-elected in 2024.
Ujjwala scheme provided LPG connections to over 80 million households.
India’s road network became the second largest globally in 2025.
Elections for Lok Sabha were held in May 2024.
E-commerce spending in India topped $120 billion in 2025.
National Education Policy was changed in 2020.
UPI transactions surpassed 12 billion monthly in 2025.
A vaccine for dengue was approved in 2024.
Metro rail expanded to 20 major Indian cities as of 2025.
Digital payment frauds reported fell by 18% in 2025.
India is the world’s largest milk producer.
The new criminal procedure code was passed in 2024.
Covid-19 lockdown began in India on March 25, 2020.
India’s population exceeded 1.44 billion in 2025.
The Vande Bharat Express launched on five new routes in 2025.
The central government adopted the Agnipath military recruitment scheme in 2022.
The country’s median age reached 29 years in 2025.
Female literacy in Kerala reached 99% in 2025.
Online education doubled in enrollment between 2020 and 2025.
India’s tallest bridge is the Chenab Rail Bridge in J&K.
The consumer price index rose by 5.2% in October 2025.
India banned single-use plastics in July 2022.
NIPUN Bharat Mission aims for foundational literacy by 2026.
The Statue of Unity is the world’s tallest statue.
New tax slabs were announced in February 2025.
India is the third largest startup hub in the world.
Farm loan waivers were issued in three states in 2024.
Tenth Pay Commission was implemented in July 2025.
The PM Suraksha Bima Yojana offers insurance of ₹2 lakh.
Government raised tiger conservation funding in 2025.
Solar rooftop installations crossed 2 million in 2025.
Regional rapid transit system started between Delhi and Meerut in 2025.
India allowed 100% FDI in telecom in 2024.
AICTE approved new engineering syllabi in September 2025.
The total forest cover of India increased by 4% since 2023.
Jan Aushadhi stores now offer 1,500 generic medicines.
Inflation-adjusted pensions for veterans were introduced in 2025.
India imported 18 million tons of crude oil from Russia in 2024.
Food processing sector employment grew by 15% in 2025.
India’s average life expectancy reached 71 years in 2025.
The pharma sector exported $25 billion worth of drugs in 2024.
The Golden Quadrilateral highways were built by 2005.
NEP 2020 recommends mother tongue in primary schools.
Government funding for AI research reached ₹2000 crore in 2025.
Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana built 700,000 km of roads.
Farmer suicides dropped by 12% in 2024.
India became the world’s second largest rice exporter in 2024.
Maternity leave in government jobs increased to 26 weeks.
40 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccines were administered by July 2021.
The largest solar park is Bhadla Solar Park in Rajasthan.
The Nirbhaya Fund was increased in 2025.
Health insurance coverage crossed 50% for Indian families in 2025.
Indian Railways electrified 80% of routes by November 2025.
The GST Council raised compensation cess on luxury goods in 2025.
National Digital Health Mission launched in 2021.
The percentage of children under five with stunted growth fell to 23% in 2025.
MGNREGA provided 3 billion workdays in 2025.
The RBI digital rupee pilot began in Mumbai in 2024.
MG Motor India opened its electric vehicle plant in Gujarat in 2025.
Jeevan Pramaan enabled digital life certificates for pensioners.
The minimum wage for industrial workers increased by ₹500 in 2025.
The Aatmanirbhar Bharat initiative started in 2020.
Government built 10 million affordable homes under PMAY by 2025.
ISRO successfully launched Chandrayaan-3 in 2023.
The Defence budget for India reached ₹6 lakh crore in 2025.
Festivals like Diwali and Holi are celebrated nationwide.
India’s literacy rate among urban youth reached 94% in 2025.
The latest National Family Health Survey was released in 2025.
All rural households to have piped water by 2026.
The BharatNet project connected 600,000 villages with broadband in 2025.
